title: Why is the basicity of group 2 elements greater than that of group 1 elements? - Quora

response.answer_text: Because the bases of Group 2 elements require 2 atoms of Hydrogen to neutralize them, whereas the bases of Group 1 elements only require 1 atom. This is NOT to be confused with the fact that the Group 1 bases are stronger bases than the Group 2 bases. This is because they form H3O+ (hydronium) ions much more readily.
